meanings.definition: The quality of being suitable for consumption as food.
meanings.sent1: The ediblenesses of the fruits made them a popular choice for the picnic.
meanings.sent2: I always check the ediblenesses of the vegetables before cooking them.
meanings.sent3: The ediblenesses of the cookies were so tempting that I couldn't resist having one more.
meanings.sent4: The chef's skill in determining the ediblenesses of various ingredients was truly impressive.
meanings.sent5: The ediblenesses of the freshly baked bread filled the kitchen with a delightful aroma.

meanings.sent1: The ediblenesses of the mushrooms were questionable, so I decided not to include them in the dish.
meanings.sent2: We always consider the ediblenesses of the food items before stocking them in the pantry.
meanings.sent3: The ediblenesses of the expired products were clearly marked on the shelves.
meanings.sent4: The hiker's survival skills were put to the test when he had to determine the ediblenesses of the wild plants.
meanings.sent5: The ediblenesses of the fish were evident from their fresh smell and clear eyes.
